member.name: T:Piglet.Lexer.Configuration.ILexerConfigurator`1
member.summary: ILexerConfigurator is the main configuration interface used to configure the lexer behaviour programmatically. This is used inside the LexerFactory.Configure method and should not be retained after the lexer has been created. Further modifying the LexerConfigurator after a lexer has been created will not result in modifications to the lexer.
member.typeparam: The output type of semantic values given by the token action method

member.name: M:Piglet.Lexer.Configuration.ILexerConfigurator`1.Token(System.String,System.Func{System.String,`0})
member.summary: Register a token in the lexer. The tokens will be recognized in order of declaration, i.e. an earlier declare token will be recognized over one that is declared later.
member.param: The regular expression to match
Action to run when a token is matched. Input to action is matched lexeme, output should be object of T

member.name: M:Piglet.Lexer.Configuration.ILexerConfigurator`1.Ignore(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a regex to the list of ignored expressions. The lexer will always favour the normal tokens over ignored expressions. Ignored expressions are never reported from the Next function of the lexer.
member.param: Expression to ignore

member.name: P:Piglet.Lexer.Configuration.ILexerConfigurator`1.EndOfInputTokenNumber
member.summary: Set the token number that will be reported when the lexer reached the end of the input stream. Default is -1

member.name: P:Piglet.Lexer.Configuration.ILexerConfigurator`1.MinimizeDfa
member.summary: Should the resulting DFA be minimized? The default is true, and it should normally be kept that way

member.name: P:Piglet.Lexer.Configuration.ILexerConfigurator`1.IgnoreCase
member.summary: Specifies whether the lexer is case-insensitive (), or case-sensitive ().

member.name: P:Piglet.Lexer.Configuration.ILexerConfigurator`1.Runtime
member.summary: Gets and sets the lexer runtime, which is the method that the resulting lexer will be constructed with.

member.name: T:Piglet.Lexer.Configuration.LexerRuntime
member.summary: This enumeration specifies what runtime the lexer should use. This is a tradeoff between construction speed and runtime speed.

member.name: F:Piglet.Lexer.Configuration.LexerRuntime.Tabular
member.summary: Tabular is the slowest to construct but the fastest to run. Lexers built this way will use an internal table to perform lookups. Use this method if you only construct your lexer once and reuse it continually or parsing very large texts. Time complexity is O(1) - regardless of input size or grammar size. Memory usage is constant, but might incur a larger memory use than other methods for small grammars.

member.name: F:Piglet.Lexer.Configuration.LexerRuntime.Nfa
member.summary: Nfa means that the lexer will run as a non-finite automata. This method of constructing is VERY fast but slower to run. Also, the lexing performance is not linear and will vary based on the configuration of your grammar. Initially uses less memory than a tabular approach, but might increase memory usage as the lexing proceeds.

member.name: F:Piglet.Lexer.Configuration.LexerRuntime.Dfa
member.summary: Runs the lexing algorithm as a deterministic finite automata. This method of construction is slower than NFA, but faster than Tabular. It runs in finite memory and has a complexity of O(1) but a slower run time and more memory usage than a tabular lexer.

member.name: T:Piglet.Parser.Configuration.ILexerSettings
member.summary: Set additional settings for the lexer

member.name: P:Piglet.Parser.Configuration.ILexerSettings.CreateLexer
member.summary: Set to false if you do not desire a lexer. You will need to supply a lexer manually. Defaults to true

member.name: P:Piglet.Parser.Configuration.ILexerSettings.EscapeLiterals
member.summary: Should all literals in parsing rules be automatically escaped? Defaults to true

member.name: P:Piglet.Parser.Configuration.ILexerSettings.Ignore
member.summary: Set the list of regular expressions to ignore. The default is to ignore all kinds of whitespace.

member.name: P:Piglet.Parser.Configuration.ILexerSettings.IgnoreCase
member.summary: Specifies whether the lexer is case-insensitive (), or case-sensitive ().

member.name: P:Piglet.Parser.Configuration.ILexerSettings.Runtime
member.summary: Gets and sets the runtime of the constructed lexer. See the enumeration LexerRuntime for an explanation of the valid values.

member.name: T:Piglet.Parser.Configuration.INonTerminal`1
member.summary: A non terminal in a given grammar, which may be configured to have productions.
member.typeparam: Semantic value of tokens in the grammar

member.name: M:Piglet.Parser.Configuration.INonTerminal`1.AddProduction(System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a production on a given non-terminal. The parts parameter may contains either previously declared symbols of the grammar or strings, which are interpreted as terminals which may be given unescaped as per the lexer settings of the main configurator object. If an empty rule is desired you may pass no parameters to the Production. Null must not be passed.
member.param: Parts of rule to configure the production
member.returns: A production configurator for the created production, for addition configuration.

member.name: T:Piglet.Parser.Configuration.IParserConfigurator`1
member.summary: This interface is the main interface for configuring a new parser in code. It is only valid in the context that is is obtained, typically in ParserFactory. If methods are called after the parser has been created no changes will be applied to the already created parser.

member.name: M:Piglet.Parser.Configuration.IParserConfigurator`1.CreateTerminal(System.String,System.Func{System.String,`0},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a new Terminal. If using the built in lexer terminals will be recognized in the order of declaration, unless the topPrecedence is set. A top precedence will be recognized before all other declared terminals. A terminal may not be redefined using different onParse actions.
member.param: Regular expression to match
Action to take on parsing. If null is passed the default action is f => default(T)
If true, this terminal takes precedence over previously created terminals

member.name: M:Piglet.Parser.Configuration.IParserConfigurator`1.CreateNonTerminal
member.summary: Creates a new non-terminal. Production actions may be specified directly, or deferred until later. The latter is more typical since rules are often recursive in their nature.

member.name: P:Piglet.Parser.Configuration.IParserConfigurator`1.LexerSettings
member.summary: Additional lexer settings in addition to the settings provided by the declared terminals.

member.name: P:Piglet.Parser.Configuration.IParserConfigurator`1.ErrorToken
member.summary: The error token, used for catching errors in the parsing process.

member.name: M:Piglet.Parser.Configuration.IParserConfigurator`1.LeftAssociative(Piglet.Parser.Configuration.ITerminal{`0}[])
member.summary: Makes a group of tokens left associative at a given precedence level. If you require two or more tokens to have the same precedence you must pass both at the same time to the precedence call. If you pass the same token to a precedence function more than once you will get a ParserConfigurationException.
member.param: Symbols to set associativity on

member.name: M:Piglet.Parser.Configuration.IParserConfigurator`1.RightAssociative(Piglet.Parser.Configuration.ITerminal{`0}[])
member.summary: Makes a group of tokens right associative at a given precedence level. If you require two or more tokens to have the same precedence you must pass both at the same time to the precedence call. If you pass the same token to a precedence function more than once you will get a ParserConfigurationException.
member.param: Symbols to set associativity on

member.name: M:Piglet.Parser.Configuration.IParserConfigurator`1.NonAssociative(Piglet.Parser.Configuration.ITerminal{`0}[])
member.summary: Makes a group of tokens non-associative at a given precedence level. If you require two or more tokens to have the same precedence you must pass both at the same time to the precedence call. If you pass the same token to a precedence function more than once you will get a ParserConfigurationException.
member.param: Symbols to set associativity on

member.name: M:Piglet.Parser.Configuration.IParserConfigurator`1.SetStartSymbol(Piglet.Parser.Configuration.INonTerminal{`0})
member.summary: Sets the given non-terminal symbol as start symbol
member.param: Non-terminal symbol

member.name: M:Piglet.Parser.Configuration.IParserConfigurator`1.CreateParser
member.summary: Creates a parser based on the inputted configuration. If a lexer has been desired as well, this method will also create the lexer.

member.name: T:Piglet.Parser.Configuration.Extensions
member.summary: A static class containing generic extension methods for .

member.name: M:Piglet.Parser.Configuration.Extensions.CreateTerminal``1(Piglet.Parser.Configuration.IParserConfigurator{``0},System.String,``0,System.Boolean)
member.param: The parser configurator.
Regular expression to match.
The value stored inside the terminal symbol.
If true, this terminal takes precedence over previously created terminals.

member.param: The parser configurator.

member.summary:
Creates a new reduce production on the given non-terminal symbol.
